name: Courtyard by Marriott Paso Robles

reviews.text: We arrived to the town of Paso Robles by Coast Starlight. With no further transportation, and no hotel shuttle service, we were still able to use the low-cost City shuttle. With bags in tow, we were dropped off a fairly long block from the hotel entrance. The room was typical Courtyard with not quite the stellar bedding. The food service was Courtyard as well but the Chef was friendly. Most people crowded the breakfast buffet with not much interest in the after 5 service. luckily the Town Square was a gem with many local restaurants and one movie house. Upon departure the bus service was not working due to a holiday. There was only one Taxi service and it was difficult to hire. The absolute best part of our trip was discovering that the best wine tasting rooms were the free one's at the train station.
reviews.title: Discount stay for your wine tours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Courtyard by Marriott was a lovely place. Not luxury like some Marriotts, but it was clean, the staff went out of their way to help us, it was close to everything, and the food was good! I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Paso Robles CA Marriott was excelent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable and updated. Staff was extremely knowledgeable about area and good places to eat. Definitely recommend this place.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Perfect stay... best hotel in the area! Everything was as expected for a Marriott property... NEW, Clean, bright and quiet (one side does face the fwy though)... This property has me re-thinking my previous opinion of the Courtyard brand... I would stay at a Courtyard every time if it was as nice a this property and breakfast were included (even so, 9.95 for a breakfast buffet is very reasonable) - One downside - Painfully slow Internet.
reviews.title: Great Night Sleep

reviews.text: Loved this hotel for the comfort and amenities for the business traveller. I really appreciated the workspace, including a double desk and adjustable chair. The room was larged and well arranged.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a quick trip to Paso over July 4th weekend to relax and visit a few wineries. The Courtyard was very nice. At checkin the young lady at the desk made us feel welcome and took time to tell us all about some of the local wineries and even gave us coupons for some free wine tastings. The hotel also made some restaurant recommendations that turned out nicely. The room was exceptionally clean, the bathroom spacious and there was also a mini fridge in the room. We had a room on the freeway side. There was no view, but no noise either. Everything exceeded our expectations for a Courtyard and we'll definitely return.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: Stayed here with friends recently and was pleasantly surprised by the high standard.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean hotel with free wi fi

reviews.text: Beds very comfortable with crips white sheets. Bathroom has complimentary toiletries and plenty of towels, though no extractor so steamed up quite a bit especially as one person after the other had a shower. The air conditioning was quite loud and woke me when it clicked on and off, though the others slept through it. The hotel looked new and was about 10 blocks away from a very nice town centre. It wasnt far to walk which we did for dinner - always good to work up an appetite. Breakfast wasnt included (why not?) so no idea if it was any good. There was a fridge in the room and ice down the corridor. The swiming pool was hogged by 6 children so far too crowded to use it, but the gym was quite good with new equipment which we used. The staff were very friendly and gave advice on places to eat and visit. Good location as its central to many places to visit and we would certainly come here again.
reviews.title: Very nice...........

reviews.text: Stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Paso Robles at the end of June 2011. I was there for 5 nights, on business, and with a large group.
reviews.title: Nice property

reviews.text: Checking in was a breeze and front desk employees were professional. This is a newer hotel and the grounds were clean with plenty of parking.
reviews.title: A cozy place in a beautiful town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for only one night after wine tasting in the area. Though the hotel looks brand new and everything is spotless, there were a couple basic amenities they need to look at. First the heater, on a chilly night the heater was only spewing out "cool" air even though I cranked the thermostat all the way up to 80 deg F just to see if it will actually work as a heater; ended up just turning it off. Secondly, Coutryards are supposed to be business hotels and even though I wasn't there for business, I would expect their Wi-Fi to work consistently. In the 2nd floor the signal was spotty and kept going in and out. I've stayed in less swanky places in South America that had better Wi-Fi reception. Overall, still would come back here again, and would gladly change it from a 3-star to 5-star rating if they fixed those two things.
reviews.title: Needs to pay attention to details

reviews.text: Stumbled across this gem and wow, what amazing people - and not just in the hotel ,but the whole town are so nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Staff are majical

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and looked around the local wineries and golf courses. The staff were very knowledgable with the local sights.
reviews.title: Good One Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with an omlette chef there waiting on you and all very well priced.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Courtyard Paso Robles for only one night. The room that I stayed in was a suite and was really clean. The suite had a wet bar, small frig, and microwave in the living room. Living room had a flat screen TV and a clothes closet. Bedroom also had a tv with its own clothes closet. This is a newer Courtyard but not one with the new lobbies. TV has some HDTV programming.
reviews.title: Great Wine Tasting location!

reviews.text: Warm welcome on checkin from the staff, who are connected to the local community. We requested a room away from the freeway. The desk person gave us a choice of a king room away from the freeway or a king suite facing the freeway, an elite upgrade. We took the king suite, which is wonderful! Lots of room and no noise from the freeway.
reviews.title: Warm welcome from desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to get this room as a Marriott Reward, so we were happy it was so nice. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and attractive. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and a very nice staff. We had only one complaint, which was the very noisy air conditioning unit, which we needed due to the heat wave during our stay.
reviews.title: Very Nice Room

reviews.text: We had a delicious breakfast in the hotel, for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Excellent Choice in Paso
reviews.text: Have stayed in this hotel many times for business trips. Staff is always courteous and helpful. Have good recommendations for restaurants in the area in addition to having good food in the bar. Rooms have always been clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Newer property. Excellent value for the money. Rooms are well designed and nicely appointed. Beds are great. Very friendly and attentive staff. Not the most central location, but will easily suffice if you are willing to drive a few minutes. Will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Marriott as usual does an excellent job.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Paso Robles Hotel Paso Robles
description: The newest hotel in Paso Robles, California's wine country! With its superior accommodations, unexpected touches and focus on the needs of today's business & leisure traveler, the Courtyard Paso Robles hotel offers an outstanding value. Located near Highway 101, popular wineries, beaches and attractions like Hearst Castle, you can take advantage of the best of the central coast region. As a guest at the Courtyard Paso Robles hotel, you'll also enjoy a spacious guest room that ingeniously blends comfort and function. There's luxurious bedding to lull you to sleep and a desk, ergonomic chair and free Wi-Fi to keep you productive. The Courtyard Café offers tempting daily dinner specials along with an extensive local wine list, and an expanded, reasonably priced hot breakfast buffet each morning. And just as you'd expect from a fine hotel in Paso Robles, California, there's a heated pool and spa to soothe and relax you. We look forward to your stay!
